attachments.title: MediaRecorder.stop() is not working while trying to record audio from livestream
attachments.text: Hi guys i am running through a query where am stuck little bit. Am trying to record live streaming audio using MediaRecorder but while calling stop function its showing an error "illegal expression...
attachments.fallback: MediaRecorder.stop() is not working while trying to record audio from livestream

text: <@U0A5KJJTA> better to ask than to ask to ask :wink:
is their any other method rather than mediarecorder
<@U0A5KJJTA> never used that part of the SDK. are you getting a RuntimeException when you run the code, or is a compiler error?
I see you have the try/catch commented out
its because am getting a illegal expression error
if i give trycatch around stoprecording function the app wont crash but it will throw an exeption saying recording not done
i need to record audio from live stream
> Note that a RuntimeException is intentionally thrown to the application, if no valid audio/video data has been received when stop() is called.
so you can ignore that exception as long as you didn't actually start recording anything
but I'm not really sure when that scenario would apply, like I said I haven't used MediaRecorder :x
but my player is receiving audio from specified audio url
what exactly is the error again?
Mediaplayer is recieving audio while calling startPlaying() function

attachments.title: android - MediaRecorder throws illegalstateexception
attachments.text: I am trying to develop a simple android audio recorder.Everything builds fine and it also runs fine on the android device. It seems like i can start the recording but when i want to stop it throws a

text:
FATAL EXCEPTION: main
    java.lang.IllegalStateException

try writing to internal storage first?
and to get lil specified i gave this thing
but here my prob lies upon recording
so writing to internal storage doesnt work as well?
so im guessing your output file path is inaccessible
that's why i suggested writing to internal storage first
internal storage as in, the private storage for your app
<@U054A24ET>:  i've changed that path to getFileDir().getPath();

add a `OnErrorListener` to your mediaplayer to see if there are any errors being thrown after `start()` and `prepare()`
<@U0A5KJJTA>: If you click the little + icon to the left of the text entry and then „create a snippet“ it clutters the chat way less :wink:
